Terms of Service

Last updated: December 2024

Agreement to Terms

By downloading, installing, or using DigitalKeep, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, do not use the application.

Use of the Service

License

We grant you a limited, non-exclusive, non-transferable, revocable license to use DigitalKeep for personal, non-commercial purposes.

Acceptable Use

You agree not to:

  • Use the app for any illegal purpose
  • Attempt to reverse engineer the application
  • Distribute or share the app without authorization
  • Use the app to store illegal or harmful content

User Content

You retain ownership of all documents and content you create, scan, or upload using DigitalKeep. You are responsible for:

  • The legality of your content
  • Maintaining backups of important documents
  • Ensuring you have rights to store the content

Cloud Services

When using cloud synchronization features:

  • Your data is stored in your personal cloud account (iCloud or Google Drive)
  • Cloud services are subject to their respective terms of service
  • We are not responsible for third-party service availability

Disclaimer of Warranties

DigitalKeep is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee:

  • Uninterrupted or error-free operation
  • Accuracy of document scanning or OCR
  • Compatibility with all devices
  • Data preservation in all circumstances

Limitation of Liability

To the maximum extent permitted by law, we shall not be liable for any indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages arising from your use of DigitalKeep.

Changes to Terms

We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the app after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.

Termination

We may terminate or suspend your access to DigitalKeep at any time, without prior notice, for conduct that violates these terms or is harmful to other users.

Governing Law

These terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with applicable laws, without regard to conflict of law principles.
